titleStmt.title: Theodore Schwartz to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2308

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: My friend, Mr Mackwitz of St Louis, requests me to endorse his petition to have his commission as "Commissioner of Deeds" renewed, which I cheerfully do, knowing him to be a gentleman of honesty & integrity, of capable mind and industrious habits, who is well calculated to fill the place faithfully. He is futhermore a staunch Union man and always has been
If therefore compatible with your Excellency's views I would most respectfully request his re-commission

I am very respectfully
Your most obdt Svt
Theod Schwartz.

His Excellency
Governor Bramlett
Frankfort Ky.
Gov --

You may rely, most implicitly on any statement of Mr Thos Schwartz. He is my friend and a gentleman
Novr 14/65

Resply,
Your obt svt
Bland Ballard

Comr of Deeds
Missouri
Rudolph Mackwitz
comd 15th Nov/65
